title: Top 3 highest champion skill floors?
body: I have no idea. What would you guys say?

replies.body:
Skill floor, not skill ceiling. huh..

{{champion:136}} Complicated positioning to lasthit/kite is weirder than most ADCs, very unforgiving of errors

{{champion:432}} Basically a jungler that farms screaming penguins instead of monsters, and can stun his entire team with his ult.
{{champion:268}} Bizarre animation mechanics and complicated combos. He requires very different strategy from most supports.

They all have complicated or bizarre mechanics that are central to their kit, as a result almost nobody plays them, and the people that do usually make amusing errors.
Lux is super easy but good
That's not what I mean't... A skill floor is how hard a champion is to pick up/learn, higher meaning harder.

Oh then here's my 3
{{champion:30}} super strong when played right but really high skill cap
{{champion:34}} she's just hard to play and get used to but can be strong too
{{champion:245}} kinda awkward playing with him since you can't rely on his ult to do damage unless it's some special circumstances

Skill floors not skill caps?

{{champion:119}} Micromanaging axes
{{champion:61}} Proper positioning, angles and ball placement
{{champion:35}} Needs to outplay opponent in order to succeed

{{champion:67}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:268}} 

as much as i hate {{champion:157}} i will admit it does take some effort and level of skill to be really good at him.
I'm gonna have to disagree with you on Vayne and Lee Sin. I've played both of them a few times and I didn't have any problems with learning/playing them.
